1.name: A Clockwork Orange
1.description: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

2.name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
2.description: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

3.name: Dirty Harry
3.description: When a madman calling himself "the Scorpio Killer" menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector "Dirty" Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath.

4.name: The Last Picture Show
4.description: In 1951, a group of high schoolers come of age in a bleak, isolated, atrophied West Texas town that is slowly dying, both culturally and economically.

5.name: Le Mans
5.description: Almost at the verge of documentary, film depicts a single auto race from the ground up.

6.name: The French Connection
6.description: A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.

7.name: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
7.description: An apprentice witch, three kids and a cynical magician conman search for the missing component to a magic spell to be used in the defense of Britain in World War II.

8.name: Diamonds Are Forever
8.description: A diamond smuggling investigation leads James Bond to Las Vegas, where he uncovers an evil plot involving a rich business tycoon.

9.name: Fiddler on the Roof
9.description: In prerevolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant contends with marrying off three of his daughters while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

10.name: Play Misty for Me
10.description: The life of a disc jockey is turned upside down after a romantic encounter with an obsessed fan.

11.name: The Andromeda Strain
11.description: A team of top scientists work feverishly in a secret, state-of-the-art laboratory to discover what has killed the citizens of a small town and learn how this deadly contagion can be stopped.

12.name: Klute
12.description: A small-town detective searching for a missing man has only one lead: a connection with a New York prostitute.

13.name: The Devils
13.description: In 17th-century France, Father Urbain Grandier seeks to protect the city of Loudun from the corrupt establishment of Cardinal Richelieu. Hysteria occurs within the city when he is accused of witchcraft by a sexually repressed nun.

14.name: Harold and Maude
14.description: Young, rich, and obsessed with death, Harold finds himself changed forever when he meets lively septuagenarian Maude at a funeral.

15.name: Walkabout
15.description: Two city-bred siblings are stranded in the Australian Outback, where they learn to survive with the aid of an Aboriginal boy on his "walkabout": a ritual separation from his tribe.

16.name: THX 1138
16.description: In the twenty-fifth century, a time when people have designations instead of names, a man, THX 1138, and a woman, LUH 3417, rebel against their rigidly controlled society.

17.name: Big Jake
17.description: In 1909, when John Fain's gang kidnaps Jacob McCandles' grandson and holds him for ransom, Big Jake sets out to rescue the boy.

18.name: Carnal Knowledge
18.description: Chronicling the lifelong sexual development of two men who meet and befriend one another in college.

19.name: Straw Dogs
19.description: A young American and his English wife come to rural England and face increasingly vicious local harassment.

20.name: The Anderson Tapes
20.description: After Duke Anderson is released from prison after ten years for taking the rap for a scion of a Mafia family, he cashes in a debt of honor with the mob to bankroll a caper.

21.name: Vanishing Point
21.description: During the 1970s, car delivery driver Kowalski delivers hot rods in record time but always runs into trouble with the highway cops.

22.name: Shaft
22.description: Cool black private eye John Shaft is hired by a crime lord to find and retrieve his kidnapped daughter.

23.name: Soleil rouge
23.description: In 1870, a gang robs a train and steals a ceremonial Japanese sword meant as a gift from Japan to the U.S. President, prompting a manhunt to retrieve it.

24.name: Giù la testa
24.description: A low-life bandit and an IRA explosives expert rebel against the existing government and become heroes of the Mexican Revolution.

25.name: The Omega Man
25.description: Lone survivor, doctor Robert Neville, struggles to create a cure for the plague that wiped out most of the human race while fighting The Family, a savage luddite death cult formed by the zombie-like infected to erase the past.

26.name: The Tragedy of Macbeth
26.description: A ruthlessly ambitious Scottish lord seizes the throne with the help of his scheming wife and a trio of witches.

27.name: The Beguiled
27.description: While imprisoned in a Confederate girls' boarding school, an injured Union soldier cons his way into each of the lonely women's hearts, causing them to turn on each other, and eventually, on him.

28.name: Johnny Got His Gun
28.description: In this tragic, dark, anti-war satire, a patriotic young American in WW1 is rendered blind, deaf, limbless, and mute by a horrific artillery shell attack. Trapped in what's left of his body, he desperately looks for a way to end his life.

29.name: Two-Lane Blacktop
29.description: 2 men drag-racing across the U.S., in a '55 Chevy. Dennis Wilson's the mechanic, James Taylor's the driver.

30.name: Morte a Venezia
30.description: While recovering in Venice, sickly Composer Gustav von Aschenbach becomes dangerously fixated with teenager Tadzio.

31.name: Get Carter
31.description: When his brother dies under mysterious circumstances in a car accident, London gangster Jack Carter travels to Newcastle to investigate.

32.name: McCabe & Mrs. Miller
32.description: A gambler and a prostitute become business partners in a remote Old West mining town, and their enterprise thrives until a large corporation arrives on the scene.

33.name: The Panic in Needle Park
33.description: Follows the lives of heroin addicts who frequent "Needle Park" in New York City.

34.name: Brother John
34.description: A man who returns to his hometown for a funeral may have a much larger purpose in life than those around him can see.

35.name: Mary, Queen of Scots
35.description: During the sixteenth century, the Catholic Mary, Queen of Scots engages in over two decades of religious and political conflict with her cousin, the Protestant Queen Elizabeth I of England, amidst political intrigue in her native land.

36.name: Il Decameron
36.description: An adaptation of nine stories from Boccaccio's "Decameron".

37.name: Lawman
37.description: A lawman from Bannock arrives in Sabbath to arrest all the cattlemen whose wild celebration the year before resulted in the accidental death of an old man.

38.name: The Raging Moon
38.description: Bruce Pritchard is paralysed mysteriously after his Brothers wedding. Rejected by his family, he is placed in a nursing home. Angry and depressed, he finds hope with a nurse. Can Bruce find a life outside the home?

39.name: Mais ne nous délivrez pas du mal
39.description: During summer break, two bored Catholic schoolgirls vow to become Satanists and play a series of increasingly dangerous and morbid games.

40.name: Hannie Caulder
40.description: After she is raped and her husband murdered, a woman hires a bounty hunter to instruct her in the use of a gun so she can get her revenge on the three outlaws responsible.

41.name: Billy Jack
41.description: Ex-Green Beret hapkido expert saves wild horses from being slaughtered for dog food and helps protect a desert "freedom school" for runaway.

42.name: The Light at the Edge of the World
42.description: A ruthless pirate captures the keeper of a lighthouse, in the most southern city in Argentina. His goal is obvious and horrific. He plans to control the lighthouses signals in a way that the passing ships will be crushed on the rocks.

43.name: Let's Scare Jessica to Death
43.description: A recently institutionalized woman has bizarre experiences after moving into a supposedly haunted country farmhouse and fears she may be losing her sanity once again.

44.name: Summer of '42
44.description: During his summer vacation on Nantucket Island in 1942, a youth eagerly awaiting his first sexual encounter finds himself developing an innocent love for a young woman awaiting news on her soldier husband's fate in WWII.

45.name: Anand
45.description: The story of a terminally ill man who wishes to live life to the full before the inevitable occurs, as told by his best friend.

46.name: The Hospital
46.description: An over-burdened doctor struggles to find meaning in his life while a murderer stalks the halls of his hospital.

47.name: Wake in Fright
47.description: After a bad gambling bet, a schoolteacher is marooned in a town full of crazy, drunk, violent men who threaten to make him just as crazy, drunk, and violent.

48.name: Twins of Evil
48.description: A religious sect led by Gustav Weil hunts all women suspected of witchcraft, killing a number of innocent victims. Young Katy, Gustav's niece, will involve herself in a devilish cult, and become an instrument of Justice in the region.

49.name: Vampyros Lesbos
49.description: An erotic horror tale about a vixen vampiress seducing and killing women to appease her insatiable thirst for female blood.

50.name: A Gunfight
50.description: Two aging gunfighters in need of money come to an agreement to organize an actual showdown between them and sell tickets for it. The townsfolk is more than interested to see the "show".
